title: Help with compatibility problems with the dataset
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/slundberg/shap/discussions/2739
Originally posted by **AndreaSDG** October 26, 2022 So it's been a while I'm working on my thesis that talks about explainability using the Seagate multivariate time-series dataset about the HDD manufacturing process and I was trying to use SHAP to understand more about my model. I used keras to build its structure: model = tf.keras.Sequential() model.add(layers.Conv1D(128, 2, input_shape=(X_train.shape[1], X_train.shape[2]), dilation_rate=2, padding='causal')) model.add(layers.Conv1D(128, 2, dilation_rate=2, padding='causal')) model.add(layers.LSTM(128, return_sequences=True, recurrent_dropout = 0.5, dropout = 0.5)) model.add(layers.LSTM(128, return_sequences=True, recurrent_dropout = 0.5, dropout = 0.5)) model.add(layers.LSTM(128, return_sequences=True, recurrent_dropout = 0.5, dropout = 0.5)) model.add(layers.LSTM(128, return_sequences=False, recurrent_dropout = 0.5, dropout = 0.5)) model.add(layers.Dense(1, activation='sigmoid')) So it's a binary classification problem to detect if an HDD is failed or not by analyzing very small multivariate time-series (2 timesteps for each sample), I have a 3D input (samples, time-steps, features). This is the dataset information overall: ------ TRAIN ------ X_train shape: (2191, 2, 817) y_train shape: (2191, 1) Negative labels: [1748] Positive labels: [443] ------ VALIDATION ------ X_val shape: (235, 2, 817) y_val shape: (235, 1) Negative labels: [196] Positive labels: [39] ------ TEST ------ X_test shape: (983, 2, 817) y_test shape: (983, 1) Negative labels: [2183] Positive labels: [8] So my plan was to use a couple of SHAP plots, at least the main ones like force_plot and summary_plot but It seems I'm not able to make them work with this kind of dataset due to its shape. I started creating the explainer by using: explainer = shap.DeepExplainer(model, X_train) shap_values = explainer.shap_values(sample) # Just one sample of the dataset because SHAP required a lot of time just for 50 samples I also searched for people with the same problem with multivariate time-series but no progress overall. So I thought I could've asked some help here, thanks in advance for any kind of help!!
